<thinking>
The GeometricPoint class bundles geometric information about a point on a manifold. It has a constructor that takes a manifold, a local position, a world position, and a vector of derivatives. The class also has accessors for the manifold, local position, world position, and derivatives.

To implement the evaluate function in the manifold class, I need to create a GeometricPoint object and return it. The GeometricPoint object requires a manifold, a local position, a world position, and a vector of derivatives. The manifold is the current object, so I can use the this pointer. The local position is the parameter point passed to the evaluate function. The world position and derivatives need to be calculated based on the parameter point and the manifold.

I'll start by calculating the world position. This will depend on the specific manifold, so I'll need to add a virtual function to the manifold class to calculate the world position.

Next, I'll calculate the derivatives. This will also depend on the specific manifold, so I'll add another virtual function to the manifold class to calculate the derivatives.

Once I have the world position and derivatives, I can create a GeometricPoint object and return it.

I'll add the virtual functions to the manifold class and implement them in the derived classes.
</thinking>

<write_to_file>
<path>include/shap/manifold.hpp</path>
<content>
#pragma once
#include "coord.hpp"
#include <vector>
#include <stdexcept>
#include <functional>

namespace shap {

// Forward declarations
template<int ParamDim, int TargetDim, typename SpaceTag>
class GeometricPoint;

class Path3D;
class SurfacePath;

/** 
 * Base class for manifolds that map from parameter space to target space.
 * 
 * @tparam ParamDim Dimension of parameter space (1 for paths, 2/3 for surfaces)
 * @tparam TargetDim Dimension of target space (2 or 3 for world space)
 * @tparam SpaceTag WorldSpaceTag or ParamSpaceTag for target space
 */
template<int ParamDim, int TargetDim, typename SpaceTag>
class Manifold {
public:
    static_assert(ParamDim >= 1 && ParamDim <= 3, "Parameter space must be 1D, 2D, or 3D");
    static_assert(TargetDim >= 2 && TargetDim <= 3, "Target space must be 2D or 3D");
    static_assert(ParamDim <= TargetDim || std::is_same_v<SpaceTag, ParamSpaceTag>,
                 "Parameter dimension cannot exceed target dimension in world space");

    using ParameterPoint = Coord<ParamDim, PointTag, ParamSpaceTag>;
    using TargetPoint = Coord<TargetDim, PointTag, SpaceTag>;
    using TargetVector = Coord<TargetDim, VectorTag, SpaceTag>;

    using WorldPositionFunc = std::function<TargetPoint(const ParameterPoint& param)>;
    using DerivativesFunc = std::function<std::vector<TargetVector>(const ParameterPoint& param)>;

    Manifold(WorldPositionFunc world_position_func, DerivativesFunc derivatives_func)
        : world_position_func_(world_position_func), derivatives_func_(derivatives_func) {}

    [[nodiscard]] GeometricPoint<ParamDim, TargetDim, SpaceTag> 
    evaluate(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
        TargetPoint world_position = world_position_func_(param);
        std::vector<TargetVector> derivatives = derivatives_func_(param);
        return GeometricPoint<ParamDim, TargetDim, SpaceTag>(this, param, world_position, derivatives);
    }

private:
    WorldPositionFunc world_position_func_;
    DerivativesFunc derivatives_func_;
};

// Common manifold type aliases
using WorldPath3D = Manifold<1, 3, WorldSpaceTag>;    // 1D -> 3D world
using WorldPath2D = Manifold<1, 2, WorldSpaceTag>;    // 1D -> 2D world
using Surface2D = Manifold<2, 2, WorldSpaceTag>;      // 2D -> 2D world
using ParamPath2D = Manifold<1, 2, ParamSpaceTag>;    // 1D -> 2D param
using ParamPath3D = Manifold<1, 3, ParamSpaceTag>;    // 1D -> 3D param
using ParamSurface2D = Manifold<2, 2, ParamSpaceTag>; // 2D -> 2D param
using ParamSurface3D = Manifold<3, 3, ParamSpaceTag>; // 3D -> 3D param

} // namespace shap
</content>
</write_to_file>

<write_to_file>
<path>include/shap/manifold.hpp</path>
<content>
#pragma once
#include "coord.hpp"
#include <stdexcept>
#include <functional>

namespace shap {

// Forward declarations
template<int ParamDim, int TargetDim, typename SpaceTag>
class GeometricPoint;

class Path3D;
class SurfacePath;

/** 
 * Base class for manifolds that map from parameter space to target space.
 * 
 * @tparam ParamDim Dimension of parameter space (1 for paths, 2/3 for surfaces)
 * @tparam TargetDim Dimension of target space (2 or 3 for world space)
 * @tparam SpaceTag WorldSpaceTag or ParamSpaceTag for target space
 */
template<int ParamDim, int TargetDim, typename SpaceTag>
class Manifold {
public:
    static_assert(ParamDim >= 1 && ParamDim <= 3, "Parameter space must be 1D, 2D, or 3D");
    static_assert(TargetDim >= 2 && TargetDim <= 3, "Target space must be 2D or 3D");
    static_assert(ParamDim <= TargetDim || std::is_same_v<SpaceTag, ParamSpaceTag>,
                 "Parameter dimension cannot exceed target dimension in world space");

    using ParameterPoint = Coord<ParamDim, PointTag, ParamSpaceTag>;
    using TargetPoint = Coord<TargetDim, PointTag, SpaceTag>;
    using TargetVector = Coord<TargetDim, VectorTag, SpaceTag>;

    using WorldPositionFunc = std::function<TargetPoint(const ParameterPoint& param)>;
    using DerivativesFunc = std::function<TargetVector(const ParameterPoint& param, int derivative_index)>;

    Manifold(WorldPositionFunc world_position_func, DerivativesFunc derivatives_func)
        : world_position_func_(world_position_func), derivatives_func_(derivatives_func) {}

    [[nodiscard]] GeometricPoint<ParamDim, TargetDim, SpaceTag> 
    evaluate(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
        TargetPoint world_position = world_position_func_(param);
        TargetVector derivatives[ParamDim];
        for (int i = 0; i < ParamDim; ++i) {
            derivatives[i] = derivatives_func_(param, i);
        }
        return GeometricPoint<ParamDim, TargetDim, SpaceTag>(this, param, world_position, derivatives);
    }

private:
    WorldPositionFunc world_position_func_;
    DerivativesFunc derivatives_func_;
};

// Common manifold type aliases
using WorldPath3D = Manifold<1, 3, WorldSpaceTag>;    // 1D -> 3D world
using WorldPath2D = Manifold<1, 2, WorldSpaceTag>;    // 1D -> 2D world
using Surface2D = Manifold<2, 2, WorldSpaceTag>;      // 2D -> 2D world
using ParamPath2D = Manifold<1, 2, ParamSpaceTag>;    // 1D -> 2D param
using ParamPath3D = Manifold<1, 3, ParamSpaceTag>;    // 1D -> 3D param
using ParamSurface2D = Manifold<2, 2, ParamSpaceTag>; // 2D -> 2D param
using ParamSurface3D = Manifold<3, 3, ParamSpaceTag>; // 3D -> 3D param

} // namespace shap
</content>
</write_to_file>

#pragma once
#include "manifold.hpp"
#include "coord.hpp"

namespace shap {

template<typename SpaceTag>
class Surface3DImpl : public Manifold<2, 3, SpaceTag> {
public:
    using Manifold<2, 3, SpaceTag>::Manifold;

    [[nodiscard]] GeometricPoint<2, 3, SpaceTag> 
    evaluate(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
        // TO DO: implement evaluate function
        TargetPoint world_position = position_func_(param);
        std::array<TargetVector, 2> derivatives = {du_func_(param), dv_func_(param)};
        return GeometricPoint<2, 3, SpaceTag>(this, param, world_position, derivatives);
    }

    [[nodiscard]] std::array<TargetVector, 2> 
    derivatives(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
        // TO DO: implement derivatives function
        return {du_func_(param), dv_func_(param)};
    }
};

using WorldSurface3D = Surface3DImpl<WorldSpaceTag>;
using ParamSurface3D = Surface3DImpl<ParamSpaceTag>;

} // namespace shap
</content>
